issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
3 brokers setup for ReplicatedLevelDB master/slave conf. 
running producer and slow consumer and doing failover by stopping master broker. 

After few failovers, the leveldb throws EOF exception while reading record from the store.  
using the latest source code from activemq 5.10 branch. 

The file that has the issue: 
[root@vmx0568 data]# ls -l /solidstate/ldbkp/000000001f4022e4.log 
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 91500224 Jan 17 14:44 /solidstate/ldbkp/000000001f4022e4.log 
[root@vmx0568 data]#

fields.summary: Replicated LevelDB Store getting EOF exception

comments.body: I hava the same problem in my clusters. do you resove this problem?

I am having a similar problem with a very similar configuration:

3 servers, 1 master/2 slave configuration, seeing this exception with 5.10.0:

{code}
2015-11-20 15:57:34,832 | INFO  | Stopping BrokerService[localhost] due to exception, java.io.EOFException | org.apache.activemq.util.DefaultIOExceptionHandler | LevelDB IOException handler.
java.io.EOFException

        at org.apache.activemq.util.DataByteArrayInputStream.readBoolean(DataByteArrayInputStream.java:189)[activemq-client-5.10.0.jar:5.10.0]

        at org.apache.activemq.broker.region.Queue.iterate(Queue.java:1658)[activemq-broker-5.10.0.jar:5.10.0]
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)[activemq-client-5.10.0.jar:5.10.0]
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)[activemq-client-5.10.0.jar:5.10.0]

{code}

Are there any solutions or anything to check.  This feels like message corruption in the leveldb which causes de-serialization errors...
LevelDB has been deprecated and is no longer being maintained.
